t: Psalm 105
Tell of All His Wondrous Works
Oh*pn give thanks to the Lord;*s call upon his name; make*ld known his deeds among the peoples!
Sing*ln to him, sing praises to him; tell*ld of all his wondrous works!
Glory*ln in his holy name; let*ld the hearts of those who seek the Lord*s rejoice!
Seek*ln the Lord*s and his strength; seek*ld his presence continually!
Remember*ln the wondrous works that he has done, his*ld miracles, and the judgments he uttered,
O*ln offspring of Abraham, his servant, children*ld of Jacob, his chosen ones!
He*pn is the Lord*s our God; his*ld judgments are in all the earth.
He*ln remembers his covenant forever, the*ld word that he commanded, for a thousand generations,
the*ln covenant that he made with Abraham, his*ld sworn promise to Isaac,
which*ln he confirmed to Jacob as a statute, to*ld Israel as an everlasting covenant,
saying,*ln “To you I will give the land of Canaan as*ld your portion for an inheritance.”
When*pn they were few in number, of*ld little account, and sojourners in it,
wandering*ln from nation to nation, from*ld one kingdom to another people,
he*ln allowed no one to oppress them; he*ld rebuked kings on their account,
saying,*ln “Touch not my anointed ones, do*ld my prophets no harm!”
When*pn he summoned a famine on the land and*ld broke all supply of bread,
he*ln had sent a man ahead of them, Joseph,*ld who was sold as a slave.
His*ln feet were hurt with fetters; his*ld neck was put in a collar of iron;
until*ln what he had said came to pass, the*ld word of the Lord*s tested him.
The*ln king sent and released him; the*ld ruler of the peoples set him free;
he*ln made him lord of his house and*ld ruler of all his possessions,
to*ln bind his princes at his pleasure and*ld to teach his elders wisdom.
Then*pn Israel came to Egypt; Jacob*ld sojourned in the land of Ham.
And*ln the Lord*s made his people very fruitful and*ld made them stronger than their foes.
He*ln turned their hearts to hate his people, to*ld deal craftily with his servants.
He*pn sent Moses, his servant, and*ld Aaron, whom he had chosen.
They*ln performed his signs among them and*ld miracles in the land of Ham.
He*ln sent darkness, and made the land dark; they*ld did not rebel against his words.
He*ln turned their waters into blood and*ld caused their fish to die.
Their*ln land swarmed with frogs, even*ld in the chambers of their kings.
He*ln spoke, and there came swarms of flies, and*ld gnats throughout their country.
He*ln gave them hail for rain, and*ld fiery lightning bolts through their land.
He*ln struck down their vines and fig trees, and*ld shattered the trees of their country.
He*ln spoke, and the locusts came, young*ld locusts without number,
which*ln devoured all the vegetation in their land and*ld ate up the fruit of their ground.
He*ln struck down all the firstborn in their land, the*ld firstfruits of all their strength.
Then*pn he brought out Israel with silver and gold, and*ld there was none among his tribes who stumbled.
Egypt*ln was glad when they departed, for*ld dread of them had fallen upon it.
He*pn spread a cloud for a covering, and*ld fire to give light by night.
They*ln asked, and he brought quail, and*ld gave them bread from heaven in abundance.
He*ln opened the rock, and water gushed out; it*ld flowed through the desert like a river.
For*ln he remembered his holy promise, and*ld Abraham, his servant.
So*pn he brought his people out with joy, his*ld chosen ones with singing.
And*ln he gave them the lands of the nations, and*ld they took possession of the fruit of the peoples’ toil,
that*ln they might keep his statutes and*ld observe his laws. Praise*ln the Lord!*s
